t: Isaiah 30
Judah Warned against Egyptian Alliance
“Woe*pn to the rebellious children,” declares the Lord,*s “Who*ln execute a plan, but not Mine, And*ln make an alliance, but not of My Spirit, In*ln order to add sin to sin;
Who*ln proceed down to Egypt Without*ln consulting Me, To*ln take refuge in the safety of Pharaoh And*ln to seek shelter in the shadow of Egypt!
Therefore*ln the safety of Pharaoh will be your shame And*ln the shelter in the shadow of Egypt, your humiliation.
For*ln their princes are at Zoan And*ln their ambassadors arrive at Hanes.
Everyone*ln will be ashamed because of a people who cannot profit them, Who*iln are*i not for help or profit, but for shame and also for reproach.”

The*p oracle concerning the beasts of the Negev. Through*pn a land of distress and anguish, From*ln where come*i lioness and lion, viper and flying serpent, They*ln carry their riches on the backs of young donkeys And*ln their treasures on camels’ humps, To*ln a people who cannot profit them;*i
Even*ln Egypt, whose help is vain and empty. Therefore,*ln I have called her “Rahab*ln who has been exterminated.”
Now*ln go, write it on a tablet before them And*ln inscribe it on a scroll, That*ln it may serve in the time to come As*ln a witness forever.
For*ln this is a rebellious people, false sons, Sons*ln who refuse to listen To*ln the instruction of the Lord;*s
Who*ln say to the seers, “You must not see visions”;*i And*ln to the prophets, “You must not prophesy to us what is right, Speak*ln to us pleasant words, Prophesy*ln illusions.
Get*ln out of the way, turn aside from the path, Let*ln us hear no more about the Holy One of Israel.”
Therefore*p thus says the Holy One of Israel, “Since*pn you have rejected this word And*ln have put your trust in oppression and guile, and have relied on them,
Therefore*ln this iniquity will be to you Like*ln a breach about to fall, A*ln bulge in a high wall, Whose*ln collapse comes suddenly in an instant,

Whose*ln collapse is like the smashing of a potter’s jar, So*ln ruthlessly shattered That*ln a sherd will not be found among its pieces To*ln take fire from a hearth Or*ln to scoop water from a cistern.”
For*p thus the Lord God,*s the Holy One of Israel, has said, “In*pn repentance and rest you will be saved, In*ln quietness and trust is your strength.” But*ln you were not willing,
And*ln you said, “No, for we will flee on horses,” Therefore*ln you shall flee! “And*ln we will ride on swift horses,”*i Therefore*ln those who pursue you shall be swift.
One*ln thousand will*i flee*i at the threat of one man;*i You*ln will flee at the threat of five, Until*ln you are left as a flag on a mountain top And*ln as a signal on a hill.
God Is Gracious and Just
Therefore*pn the Lord*s longs to be gracious to you, And*ln therefore He waits on high to have compassion on you. For*ln the Lord*s is a God of justice; How*ln blessed are all those who long for Him.
O*p people in Zion, inhabitant in Jerusalem, you will weep no longer. He will surely be gracious to you at the sound of your cry; when He hears it, He will answer you.
Although the Lord has given you bread of privation and water of oppression, He,*i your Teacher will no longer hide Himself, but your eyes will behold your Teacher.
Your ears will hear a word behind you, “This is the way, walk in it,” whenever you turn to the right or to the left.
And you will defile your graven images overlaid with silver, and your molten images plated with gold. You will scatter them as an impure thing, and*i say to them, “Be gone!”

Then*p He will give you*i rain for the seed which you will sow in the ground, and bread from*i the yield of the ground, and it will be rich and plenteous; on that day your livestock will graze in a roomy pasture.
Also the oxen and the donkeys which work the ground will eat salted fodder, which has been winnowed with shovel and fork.
On every lofty mountain and on every high hill there will be streams running with water on the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.

The light of the moon will be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be seven times brighter,*i like the light of seven days, on the day the Lord*s binds up the fracture of His people and heals the bruise He has inflicted.
Behold,*pn the name of the Lord*s comes from a remote place; Burning*ln is His anger and dense is His*i smoke; His*ln lips are filled with indignation And*ln His tongue is like a consuming fire;

His*ln breath is like an overflowing torrent, Which*ln reaches to the neck, To*ln shake the nations back and forth in a sieve, And*ln to put*i in the jaws of the peoples the bridle which leads to ruin.

You*ln will have songs as in the night when you keep the festival, And*ln gladness of heart as when one marches to the*i sound*i of*i the flute, To*ln go to the mountain of the Lord,*s to the Rock of Israel.

And*ln the Lord*s will cause His voice of authority to be heard, And*ln the descending of His arm to be seen in fierce anger, And*ln in*i the flame of a consuming fire In*ln cloudburst, downpour and hailstones.
For*ln at the voice of the Lord*s Assyria will be terrified, When*iln He strikes with the rod.
And*ln every blow of the rod of punishment, Which*ln the Lord*s will lay on him, Will*ln be with the*i music*i of*i tambourines and lyres; And*ln in battles, brandishing weapons, He will fight them.

For*ln Topheth has long been ready, Indeed,*ln it has been prepared for the king. He*ln has made it deep and large, A*ln pyre of fire with plenty of wood; The*ln breath of the Lord,*s like a torrent of brimstone, sets it afire.
